snippet.title: Little Ninja Brothers (Culture Brain, 1990) - NES Gameplay
snippet.description:
Little Ninja Brothers was a game released by Culture Brain for the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1990. The original title of the game was Super Chinese 2. The plot follows two young ninja, Jack and Ryu, attempting to find out the mysterious reason for the invasion of Chinaland by Blu Boltar. It was the second game in the series, preceded by Kung Fu Heroes and followed up by a sequel, Super Ninja Boy, released on the Super NES. Another sequel, Super Chinese 3 was never released in the US. There were also two Ninja Boy spin-off games released for the Game Boy.

Known on Famicom as: Super Chinese 2


NESGUIDE ARCHIVE INFO

The original NES gameplay archive, est 2007 includes gameplay captures from all commercial releases from the US market with a few extras (like famicom releases) just for fun. As of Dec 2024, I've resumed efforts to update some of the older (some 360p) videos with higher-def captures. Text updates will be posted to BlueSky (which doesn't require an account to view). Please follow there (or just bookmark the url) if you're interested!

https://bsky.app/profile/nesguide.com
